ISSUE.TITLE: `man podman-run` shows garbled tables
ISSUE.DESCRIPTION: ### Issue Description `man podman-run` shows some garbled tables. For example, one table is displayed as ``` | host UID | container UID | | - | - | | _fromuid | _containeruid | | _fromuid + 1 | _containeruid + 1 | | _fromuid + 2 | _containeruid + 2 | | _fromuid + 3 | _containeruid + 3 | ``` The same table is not garbled when viewing the HTML version https://docs.podman.io/en/latest/markdown/podman-run.1.html The source code of the table comes from https://github.com/containers/podman/blob/03d7ed468dfcaa883d164382b60306d131e8aa91/docs/source/markdown/options/uidmap.container.md?plain=1#L24-L29 ------------------------------- Interestingly `man podman-run` does not only show garbled tables. For example this table looks good: ``` ┌────┬───────────┬─────┬──────────────┐ │PID │ container │ CPU │ CPU share │ ├────┼───────────┼─────┼──────────────┤ │100 │ C0 │ 0 │ 100% of CPU0 │ ├────┼───────────┼─────┼──────────────┤ │101 │ C1 │ 1 │ 100% of CPU1 │ ├────┼───────────┼─────┼──────────────┤ │102 │ C1 │ 2 │ 100% of CPU2 │ └────┴───────────┴─────┴──────────────┘ ``` The source code of the table comes from https://github.com/containers/podman/blob/03d7ed468dfcaa883d164382b60306d131e8aa91/docs/source/markdown/options/cpu-shares.md?plain=1#L35-L39 ### Steps to reproduce the issue Steps to reproduce the issue 1. On Fedora 38 run `man podman-run` 2. Search for the string _specifies the number of consecutive_, by typing `/specifies the number of consecutive` and press return 3. View the garbled table ### Describe the results you received ``` | host UID | container UID | | - | - | | _fromuid | _containeruid | | _fromuid + 1 | _containeruid + 1 | | _fromuid + 2 | _containeruid + 2 | | _fromuid + 3 | _containeruid + 3 | ``` ### Describe the results you expected A nicely formatted table ### podman info output ```yaml host: arch: amd64 buildahVersion: 1.30.0 cgroupControllers: - cpuset - cpu - io - memory - hugetlb - pids - rdma - misc cgroupManager: systemd cgroupVersion: v2 conmon: package: conmon-2.1.7-2.fc38.x86_64 path: /usr/bin/conmon version: 'conmon version 2.1.7, commit: ' cpuUtilization: idlePercent: 99.94 systemPercent: 0.02 userPercent: 0.04 cpus: 16 databaseBackend: boltdb distribution: distribution: fedora variant: workstation version: "38" eventLogger: journald hostname: asus idMappings: gidmap: null uidmap: null kernel: 6.3.8-200.fc38.x86_64 linkmode: dynamic logDriver: journald memFree: 1809682432 memTotal: 7674617856 networkBackend: netavark ociRuntime: name: crun package: crun-1.8.5-1.fc38.x86_64 path: /usr/bin/crun version: |- crun version 1.8.5 commit: b6f80f766c9a89eb7b1440c0a70ab287434b17ed rundir: /run/user/0/crun spec: 1.0.0 +SYSTEMD +SELINUX +APPARMOR +CAP +SECCOMP +EBPF +CRIU +LIBKRUN +WASM:wasmedge +YAJL os: linux remoteSocket: path: /run/podman/podman.sock security: apparmorEnabled: false capabilities: CAP_CHOWN,CAP_DAC_OVERRIDE,CAP_FOWNER,CAP_FSETID,CAP_KILL,CAP_NET_BIND_SERVICE,CAP_SETFCAP,CAP_SETGID,CAP_SETPCAP,CAP_SETUID,CAP_SYS_CHROOT rootless: false seccompEnabled: true seccompProfilePath: /usr/share/containers/seccomp.json selinuxEnabled: true serviceIsRemote: false slirp4netns: executable: /usr/bin/slirp4netns package: slirp4netns-1.2.0-12.fc38.x86_64 version: |- slirp4netns version 1.2.0 commit: 656041d45cfca7a4176f6b7eed9e4fe6c11e8383 libslirp: 4.7.0 SLIRP_CONFIG_VERSION_MAX: 4 libseccomp: 2.5.3 swapFree: 7674523648 swapTotal: 7674523648 uptime: 18h 30m 2.00s (Approximately 0.75 days) plugins: authorization: null log: - COMMIT.MESSAGE: [CI:DOCS] uidmap man pages: fix corrupt tables The markdown-to-manpage sequence needs a long row of dashes, not a single dash. A single dash, as used in this one option, generates unreadable *roff. Also, some tool somewhere doesn't like too-long columns. Shrtn thm. Also, verify that there are no more three-or-fewer-dash columns: $ ack '\|\s+-{1,3}\s' docs/source/markdown Fixes: #19086 Signed-off-by: Ed Santiago <santiago@redhat.com>
